text: this is get eaten for the new york times
before you hit the slopes this winter
here are a few apps that could help make
that weekend ski trip even more exciting
philly on itunes on a dollar fifty nine
on android is ski webcams which allows
you to see the view from mountainside
cameras at ski resorts globally this
no-frills app allows you to save the
feed from your favorite cameras and many
of the photos are time-stamped so you
can get a gauge for how fresh that
powder really is next up is slow pro the
video editing app that will transform
your ski run footage from regular speed
to highlight reels slow motion the app
also makes it easy to share your slow
motion ski jumps on YouTube and Facebook
but it takes a while to get a hang of
its tricky interface additionally the
slow motion isn't nearly as good as the
real thing but for free it's certainly
worth having on your phone finally there
are resort specific apps like the
99-cent live north lake tahoe app for
iOS the app is a fairly easy to use
interface and offers features like live
camera views or peace map and road
cameras so you can plan your travel
around inclement weather but you could
also get all of those features from a
couple of free apps in tandem instead of
having to shell out a buck
